summary: Expand Cardiac Sentinel from a web dapp into a mobile app deliverable (start converting to a mobile app experience).

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication and session handling
existing_features.description: Users authenticate via Internet Identity; frontend manages actor/session lifecycle for calling the backend canister.

existing_features.title: Role-based access control (patient vs control room)
existing_features.description: Backend authorization and frontend guards enforce access policies; includes access denied screen and access-control utilities.

existing_features.title: User profile setup and editing
existing_features.description: Create/edit current user profile via dedicated UI (profile setup modal and profile editor card) persisted through backend APIs.

existing_features.title: Patient dashboard: monitoring status, readings list, and simulation controls
existing_features.description: Patient-facing dashboard shows monitoring status and readings list, with controls to simulate monitoring/readings for demo/testing.

existing_features.title: Manual SOS activation for patients
existing_features.description: Patient can manually trigger an emergency SOS event which creates an alert for the control room workflow.

existing_features.title: Alert creation and routing workflow (patient -> control room)
existing_features.description: Backend and UI support generating emergency alerts (from SOS/simulation) routed into the medical control room alert queue.

existing_features.title: Control room dashboard: alerts queue and alert detail management
existing_features.description: Control-room UI provides an alerts queue table and per-alert detail page with status/action controls to manage alert lifecycle.

existing_features.title: Control room user management UI
existing_features.description: Control-room interface includes a user-management card to manage/control room related user access context.

existing_features.title: App shell, landing page, and navigation layout
existing_features.description: Frontend includes landing page and shared app shell/header layout with navigation between patient and control-room experiences.

existing_features.title: Convert the existing Cardiac Sentinel web UI into a mobile-first, app-like experience: ensure all primary screens (Landing, Patient Dashboard, Control Room Dashboard, Alert Detail) are fully responsive on common phone widths, use touch-friendly spacing/sizing, and avoid desktop-only layout assumptions (e.g., multi-column sections collapsing cleanly to single column).

Add an installable PWA setup for Cardiac Sentinel so it can be added to a phone home screen and launched like an app: include a web app manifest, correct app icons, and required metadata in the HTML head (name, short name, theme color, display mode, start URL).

Add mobile-native navigation behavior: implement a bottom navigation pattern on small screens for authenticated users (Patient and, if authorized, Control Room), while keeping the existing desktop header navigation for larger screens.

Add an in-app “Install” help surface (e.g., a lightweight card/modal reachable from the landing page and/or header) that explains in English how to install the app on iPhone (Safari) and Android (Chrome) using “Add to Home Screen.”

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert Cardiac Sentinel from a web app into a mobile app (mobile-app-ready build and packaging)

architectural_notes: Wearable watch form factor with integrated heart-function sensor monitoring.
Emergency workflow: abnormal detection or heart attack triggers immediate text-message alert routed first to medical control room, then forwarded to nearest hospital/primary health center.
Support both spontaneous (automatic) activation and manual SOS activation by patient.
Deployed as an Internet Computer (ICP) dapp with a Motoko backend canister and a React/Vite + Tailwind frontend.
Authentication uses Internet Identity; frontend creates authenticated actors to call canister methods.
Authorization uses role-based access control with shared authorization/access-control modules in the backend.
Monitoring/heart-function inputs are simulated in the UI to generate readings and alerts for workflow demonstration.
Alert workflow implemented as a queue for medical control room triage with per-alert status/actions.
Repository now includes a reusable build-template (Dockerfile, deploy scripts, ICP canister yaml scaffolding) for the ICP Motoko + React/Vite/Tailwind dapp.
Frontend build-template incorporates shadcn/ui component primitives and related tooling (components.json, utilities, UI component set).
Added build-template tooling/scripts for asset management (resize/prune unused images) and frontend lint rules enforcing Internet Identity provider usage and preventing problematic bigint query keys.
